CDE Name: Race
Race child
Definition: Participant/subject self declared racial origination, independent of ethnic origination, using OMB approved categories

Race: Participant/subject child self declared (or parent reported) racial origination, independent of ethnic origination, using OMB approved categories. This response indicates self-declared race is American Indian or Alaska Native, A person having origins in any of the original peoples of North and South America (including Central America), and who maintains tribal affiliation or community attachment
Short Description: Participant/subject self declared racial origination, independent of ethnic origination, using OMB approved categories- American Indian or Alaska Native, A person having origins in any of the original peoples of North and South America (including Central America), and who maintains tribal affiliation or community attachment
Child race - American Indian or Alaska Native

CDE Name: Parent Race
Definition: Race: Parent/respondent self declared racial origination, independent of ethnic origination, using OMB approved categories. This response indicates self-declared race is American Indian or Alaska Native, A person having origins in any of the original peoples of North and South America (including Central America), and who maintains tribal affiliation or community attachment
Short Description: Parent/respondent race - American Indian or Alaska Native

CDE Name: Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS) - delay going to bed scale
Definition: Scale describing typical weekday sleep pattern for how frequently (what percent of the time time) participant/subject puts off or delays when it is time to go to bed, as a part of Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS)
Short Description: Scale describing how frequently participant/subject delays going to bed at bedtime, as a part of Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS)

CDE Name: Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS) Falling Asleep and Staying Asleep subscale score
Definition: Calculated subscale score for Falling Asleep and Staying Asleep; as part of the Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS)
Short Description: Falling Asleep and Staying Asleep ASWS (calculated)

CDE Name: Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS) - feel rested  scale
Definition: Scale describing typical weekday sleep pattern for how frequently (what percent of the time time) participant/subject awakens in the morning and feels rested and alert, as a part of Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS)
Short Description: Scale describing how frequently participant/subject wakes up in the morning feeling rested, as a part of Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS)

CDE Name: Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS) Going to Bed subscale score
Definition: Calculated subscale score for Going To Bed; as part of the Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS)
Short Description: Going to Bed subscale ASWS (calculated)

CDE Name: Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS) - need help getting back to sleep scale
Definition: Scale describing typical weekday sleep pattern for how frequently (what percent of the time time) participant/subject needs help getting back to sleep after an awakening, as a part of Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS)
Short Description: Scale describing how frequently participant/subject needs help getting back to sleep after an awakening, as a part of Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS)

CDE Name: Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS) - need help getting to sleep scale
Definition: Scale describing typical weekday sleep pattern for how frequently (what percent of the time time) participant/subject needs help getting to sleep, as a part of Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS)
Short Description: Scale describing how frequently participant/subject needs help getting to sleep, as a part of Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS)

CDE Name: Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS) - ready to get up scale
Definition: Scale describing typical weekday sleep pattern for how frequently (what percent of the time time) participant/subject feels awake and ready to get up upon awakening in the morning, as a part of Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS)
Short Description: Scale describing how frequently participant/subject feels ready to awaken in the morning, as a part of Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS)

CDE Name: Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS) - ready to go to bed scale
Definition: Scale describing typical weekday sleep pattern for how frequently (what percent of the time time) participant/subject is ready to go to bed when it is time to go to bed, as a part of Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS)
Short Description: Scale describing how frequently participant/subject is ready to go to bed at bedtime, as a part of Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS)

CDE Name: Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS) Returning to Wakefulness subscale score
Definition: Calculated subscale score for Returning to Wakefulness; as part of the Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS)
Short Description: Returning to Wakefulness ASWS (calculated)

CDE Name: Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS) - want to stay up scale
Definition: Scale describing typical weekday sleep pattern for how frequently (what percent of the time time) participant/subject wants to stay up when it is time to go to bed, as a part of Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS)
Short Description: Scale describing how frequently participant/subject wants to stay up at bedtime, as a part of Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS)

CDE Name: Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS) Total Measure score
Definition: Calculated overall/total measure score for the Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS)
Short Description: ASWS overall/total score

CDE Name: Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS) - trouble going back to sleep scale
Definition: Scale describing typical weekday sleep pattern for how frequently (what percent of the time time) participant/subject has trouble going back to sleep after an awakening, as a part of Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS)
Short Description: Scale describing how frequently participant/subject needs help getting back to sleep, as a part of Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS)

CDE Name: Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS) - trouble getting comfortable scale
Definition: Scale describing typical weekday sleep pattern for how frequently (what percent of the time time) participant/subject has trouble going getting comfortable after an awakening, as a part of Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS)
Short Description: Scale describing how frequently participant/subject has trouble getting comfortable after an awakening, as a part of Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS)

CDE Name: Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS) - trouble settling down scale
Definition: Scale describing typical weekday sleep pattern for how frequently (what percent of the time time) participant/subject has trouble settling down to fall asleep, as a part of Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS)
Short Description: Scale describing how frequently participant/subject has trouble settling down to fall asleep, as a part of Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS)

CDE Name: Age
Age child
Definition: Value for participant/subject's age, calculated as elapsed time since the birth of the participant/subject.
Value for participant/subject child age, calculated as elapsed time since birth.
Short Description: Value for participant/subject's age, calculated as elapsed time since the birth of the participant/subject.
Value for participant/subject child age, calculated as elapsed time since birth.

CDE Name: Age unit child
Definition: Unit of measure for Age child
Short Description: Unit of measure for Age child

CDE Name: Age unit parent
Definition: Unit of measure for Age
Short Description: Unit of Measure for Age

CDE Name: Age Parent
Definition: Value for parent/respondent age, calculated as elapsed time since the birth of the parent/respondent.
Short Description: Parent/respondent age

CDE Name: Race
Race child
Definition: Participant/subject self declared racial origination, independent of ethnic origination, using OMB approved categories

Race: Participant/subject child self declared (or parent reported) racial origination, independent of ethnic origination, using OMB approved categories. This reponse indicates self-declared race is Asian, A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Far East, Southeast Asia, or the Indian subcontinent including, for example, Cambodia, China, India, Japan, Korea, Malaysia, Pakistan, the Philippine Islands, Thailand, and Vietnam
Short Description: Participant/subject self declared racial origination, independent of ethnic origination, using OMB approved categories- Asian, A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Far East, Southeast Asia, or the Indian subcontinent including, for example, Cambodia, China, India, Japan, Korea, Malaysia, Pakistan, the Philippine Islands, Thailand, and Vietnam
Child race - Asian

CDE Name: Parent Race

This reponse indicates self-declared race is Asian, A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Far East, Southeast Asia, or the Indian subcontinent including, for example, Cambodia, China, India, Japan, Korea, Malaysia, Pakistan, the Philippine Islands, Thailand, and Vietnam
Short Description: Parent/respondent race - Asian

CDE Name: Brief Pain Inventory (BPI) - pain severity subscale score

CDE Name: Brief Pain Inventory (BPI) - worst pain rating scale

Short Description: Scale indicating the rating of the worst pain, as part of the Brief Pain Inventory (BPI) form.

Race child

CDE Name: Ethnicity category
Ethnicity category child
Definition: Category of ethnicity the participant/subject most closely identifies with. A social group characterized by a distinctive social and cultural tradition maintained from generation to generation, a common history and origin and a sense of identification with the group; members of the group have distinctive features in their way of life, shared experiences and often a common genetic heritage; these features may be reflected in their experience of health and disease

Category of ethnicity the participant/subject child most closely identifies with. A social group characterized by a distinctive social and cultural tradition maintained from generation to generation, a common history and origin and a sense of identification with the group; members of the group have distinctive features in their way of life, shared experiences and often a common genetic heritage; these features may be reflected in their experience of health and disease
Short Description: Category of ethnicity the participant/subject most closely identifies with.
Category of ethnicity the participant/subject child most closely identifies with.

CDE Name: Ethnicity category parent
Definition: Category of ethnicity the parent/respondent most closely identifies with. A social group characterized by a distinctive social and cultural tradition maintained from generation to generation, a common history and origin and a sense of identification with the group; members of the group have distinctive features in their way of life, shared experiences and often a common genetic heritage; these features may be reflected in their experience of health and disease
Short Description: Parent/respondent ethnicity

Short Description: Calculated overall/total score

CDE Name: Pain duration value
Definition: Duration in months participant/subject has experienced pain
Short Description: Duration in months participant/subject has experienced pain

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Child (PCS-C) Feel Cannot Go On Scale
Definition: Scale describing how much the participant/subject feels they cannot go on when they have pain; part of the Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Child (PCS-C)
Short Description: Scale describing how much the participant/subject feels they can't go on when they have pain, part of the PCS-C

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Child (PCS-C) Can not Stand Pain Scale
Definition: Scale describing how much the participant/subject feels that they can no longer stand the pain; part of the Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Child (PCS-C)
Short Description: Scale describing how much the participant/subject feels they cannot stand the pain; part of the PCS-C

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Child (PCS-C) Helplessness subscale total
Definition: Computed Helplessness subscale score for the Pain Catastrophizing Scale-Child (PCS-C)
Short Description: Computed Helplessness subscale score for the Pain Catastrophizing Scale-Child (PCS-C)

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Child (PCS-C) Magnification subscale total
Definition: Computed Magnification subscale score for the Pain Catastrophizing Scale-Child (PCS-C)
Short Description: Computed Magnification subscale score for the Pain Catastrophizing Scale-Child (PCS-C)

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Child (PCS-C) Never Get Better Scale
Definition: Scale describing how much the participant/subject feels pain is terrible and will never get better; part of the Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Child (PCS-C)
Short Description: Scale describing how much the participant/subject feels pain  will never get better, part of the PCS-C

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Child (PCS-C) Nothing Can Do Scale
Definition: Scale describing how much the participant/subject feels that when they are in pain there is nothing they can do to reduce the pain; part of the Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Child (PCS-C)
Short Description: Scale describing how much the participant/subject feels there is nothing they can do to reduce pain; part of the PCS-C

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Child (PCS-C) Thinking of Other Painful Events Scale
Definition: Scale describing how much the participant/subject keeps thinking about other painful events when they have pain; part of the Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Child (PCS-C)
Short Description: Scale describing how much the participant/subject keeps thinking of other painful events; part of the PCS-C

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Child (PCS-C) Pain Overwhelms Scale
Definition: Scale describing how much the participant/subject feels that pain is awful and takes over (overwhelms) them; part of the Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Child (PCS-C)
Short Description: Scale describing how much the participant/subject feels that pain is overwhelming; part of the PCS-C

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Child (PCS-C) Wants Pain to Go Away Scale
Definition: Scale describing how much the participant/subject feels they want pain to go away; part of the Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Child (PCS-C)
Short Description: Scale describing how much the participant/subject wants pain to go away; part of the PCS-C

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Child (PCS-C) Keep Pain Out of Mind Scale
Definition: Scale describing how much the participant/subject feels they cannot keep pain out of their mind; part of the Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Child (PCS-C)
Short Description: Scale describing how much the participant/subject feels they can't keep pain out of their mind; part of the PCS-C

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Child (PCS-C) Fear Pain will Worsen Scale
Definition: Scale describing how much the participant/subject fears that pain will get worse; part of the Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Child (PCS-C)
Short Description: Scale describing how much the participant/subject fears pain will worsen; part of the PCS-C

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Child (PCS-C) Rumination subscale total
Definition: Computed Rumination subscale score for the Pain Catastrophizing Scale-Child (PCS-C)
Short Description: Computed Rumination subscale score for the Pain Catastrophizing Scale-Child (PCS-C)

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Child (PCS-C) Something Serious May Happen Scale
Definition: Scale describing how much the participant/subject worries whether something serious may happen when they are in pain; part of the Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Child (PCS-C)
Short Description: Scale describing how much the participant/subject worries about whether something serious will happen when in pain; part of the PCS-C

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Child (PCS-C) Suffering Scale
Definition: Scale describing how much the participant/subject keeps thinking about how much it hurts when they have pain (how much they are suffering); part of the Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Child (PCS-C)
Short Description: Scale describing how much the participant/subject keeps thinking about how much it hurts; part of the PCS-C

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Child (PCS-C) Overall Score
Definition: Computed overall score for the Pain Catastrophizing Scale-Child (PCS-C), calculated as the sum of responses to all items.
Short Description: Computed overall score for the Pain Catastrophizing Scale-Child (PCS-C), calculated as the sum of responses to all items.

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Child (PCS-C) Want Pain to Stop Scale
Definition: Scale describing how much the participant/subject keeps thinking about how much they want pain to stop; part of the Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Child (PCS-C)
Short Description: Scale describing how much the participant/subject worries about how much they want pain to stop; part of the PCS-C

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Child (PCS-C) Worry Whether Pain will End Scale
Definition: Scale describing how much the participant/subject worries all the time about whether pain will end; part of the Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Child (PCS-C)
Short Description: Scale describing how much the participant/subject worries about whether pain will end; part of the PCS-C

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-P) Feel Cannot Go On Scale
Definition: Scale describing how much the participant/subject feels they cannot go on when their child has pain; part of the Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-C)
Short Description: Scale describing how much the participant/subject feels they can't go on when their child has pain, part of the PCS-P

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-P) Can not Stand Pain Scale
Definition: Scale describing how much the participant/subject feels that they can no longer stand their child's pain; part of the Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-C)
Short Description: Scale describing how much the participant/subject feels they cannot stand their child's pain; part of the PCS-P

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-P) Helplessness subscale total
Definition: Computed Helplessness subscale score for the Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-P)
Short Description: Computed Helplessness subscale score for the Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-P)

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-P) Magnification subscale total
Definition: Computed Magnification subscale score for the Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-P)
Short Description: Computed Magnification subscale score for the Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-P)

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-P) Never Get Better Scale
Definition: Scale describing how much the participant/subject feels their child's pain is terrible and will never get better; part of the Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-C)
Short Description: Scale describing how much the participant/subject feels their child's pain will never get better, part of the PCS-P

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-P) Nothing Can Do Scale
Definition: Scale describing how much the participant/subject feels that when their child is in pain there is nothing the parent can do to reduce the pain; part of the Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-C)
Short Description: Scale describing how much the participant/subject feels there is nothing they can do to reduce their child's pain; part of the PCS-P

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-P) Thinking of Other Painful Events Scale
Definition: Scale describing how much the participant/subject keeps thinking about other painful events when their child has pain; part of the Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-C)
Short Description: Scale describing how much the participant/subject keeps thinking of other painful events; part of the PCS-P

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-P) Overwhelm Scale
Definition: Scale describing how much the participant/subject feels that their child's pain is awful and this takes over (overwhelms) the parent; part of the Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-C)
Short Description: Scale describing how much the participant/subject feels that their child's pain overwhelms them; part of the PCS-P

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-P) Wants Pain to Go Away Scale
Definition: Scale describing how much the participant/subject feels they want their child's pain to go away; part of the Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-C)
Short Description: Scale describing how much the participant/subject wants pain to go away; part of the PCS-P

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-P) Keep Pain Out of Mind Scale
Definition: Scale describing how much the participant/subject feels they cannot keep their child's pain out of their mind; part of the Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-C)
Short Description: Scale describing how much the participant/subject feels they can't keep pain out of their mind; part of the PCS-P

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-P) Fear Pain will Worsen Scale
Definition: Scale describing how much the participant/subject fears that their child's pain will get worse; part of the Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-C)
Short Description: Scale describing how much the participant/subject fears that their child's pain will worsen; part of the PCS-P

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-P)  Rumination subscale total
Definition: Computed Rumination subscale score for thePain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-P)
Short Description: Computed Rumination subscale score for thePain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-P)

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-P) Something Serious May Happen Scale
Definition: Scale describing how much the participant/subject worries whether something serious may happen when their child is in pain; part of the Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-C)
Short Description: Scale describing how much the participant/subject worries about whether something serious will happen when the child is in pain; part of the PCS-P

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-P) Suffering Scale
Definition: Scale describing how much the participant/subject keeps thinking about how much their child is suffering when they have pain; part of the Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-C)
Short Description: Scale describing how much the participant/subject keeps thinking about how much their child is suffering; part of the PCS-P

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-P) Overall Score
Definition: Computed overall score for the Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-P) , calculated as the sum of responses to all items.
Short Description: Computed overall score for the Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-P) , calculated as the sum of responses to all items.

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-P) Want Pain to Stop Scale
Definition: Scale describing how much the participant/subject keeps thinking about how much they want their child's pain to stop; part of the Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-C)
Short Description: Scale describing how much the participant/subject thinks about how much they want pain to stop; part of the PCS-P

CDE Name: Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-P) Worry Whether Pain will End Scale
Definition: Scale describing how much the participant/subject worries all the time about whether the child's pain will end; part of the Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Parent (PCS-C)
Short Description: Scale describing how much the participant/subject worries about whether their child's pain will end; part of the PCS-P

CDE Name: PEG - average pain past week scale
Definition: Scale indicating the rating of past week average pain experienced by the subject, as part of the PEG form.
Short Description: Scale indicating the rating of the past week average pain, as part of the PEG form.

CDE Name: PEG - overall score
Definition: Computed overall score for the PEG, calculated as the arithmetic mean (average; sum of scores divided by 3).
Short Description: Computed overall score for the PEG, calculated as the arithmetic mean (average; sum of scores divided by 3).

CDE Name: PEG - pain past week enjoyment life scale
Definition: Scale indicating the rating of past week pain life enjoyment experienced by the subject, as part of the PEG form.
Short Description: Scale indicating the rating of past week pain life enjoyment experienced by the subject, as part of the PEG form.

CDE Name: PEG - pain past week general activity scale
Definition: Scale indicating the rating of past week pain general activity experienced by the subject, as part of the PEG form.
Short Description: Scale indicating the rating of past week pain general activity experienced by the subject, as part of the PEG form.

CDE Name: Patient Global Impression of Change (PGIC) Symptom change status value
Definition: Status describing the change in the subject's symptoms have since the beginning of treatment as a part of the Patient Global Impression of Change
Short Description: Status describing the change in the subject's symptoms have since the beginning of treatment as a part of the Patient Global Impression of Change

CDE Name: Patient Global Impression of Severity (PGIS) pain severity scale
Definition: Single item scale describing the participant/subject perception about overall pain severity
Short Description: Scale describing the participant/subject perception about overall pain severity

CDE Name: Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ) - total score
Definition: Calculated overall/total score
Short Description: Calculated overall/total score

CDE Name: Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ) - Depressed score
Definition: Score of how much the subject has been feeling down and depressed in the past two weeks, as part of the Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ).
Short Description: Score of how much the subject has been feeling down and depressed in the past two weeks, as part of the Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ).

CDE Name: Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ) - Little interest score
Definition: Score of how much the subject has been bothered by having little interest or pleasure in doing things in the past two weeks, as part of the Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ).
Short Description: Score of how much the subject has been bothered by having little interest or pleasure in doing things in the past two weeks, as part of the Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ).

CDE Name: Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS) - Sleep difficulty assessment past week scale
Definition: Scale which represents how often the participant had difficulty falling asleep in the past 7 days, as part of the Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS).
Short Description: Scale which represents how often the participant had difficulty falling asleep in the past 7 days, as part of the Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS).

CDE Name: Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS) - Physical function stairs normal pace ability scale
Definition: Scale which represents the extent to which the participant was able to go up and down stairs at a normal pace, as a part of the PROMIS Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS).
Short Description: Scale which represents the extent to which the participant was able to go up and down stairs at a normal pace, as a part of the PROMIS Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS).

CDE Name: Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS) - Physical function errands shopping ability scale
Definition: Scale which represents the extent to which the participant was able to run errands and shop, as a part of the Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS) .
Short Description: Scale which represents the extent to which the participant was able to run errands and shop, as a part of the Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS) .

CDE Name: Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS) - Physical function 15 minute walk scale
Definition: Scale which represents the extent to which the participant was able to go for a walk of at least 15 minutes, as a part of the Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS).
Short Description: Scale which represents the extent to which the participant was able to go for a walk of at least 15 minutes, as a part of the Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS).

CDE Name: Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS) - Physical function limit two hours physical labor scale
Definition: Scale which represents the extent to which the participant health limits the ablity to perform two hours of physical labor, as a part of the Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS).
Short Description: Scale which represents the extent to which the participant health limits the ablity to perform two hours of physical labor, as a part of the Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS).

CDE Name: Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS) -  Physical function chores ability scale
Definition: Scale which represents the extent to which the participant was able to perform chores such as vacuuming or yard work, as a part of the Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS).
Short Description: Scale which represents the extent to which the participant was able to perform chores such as vacuuming or yard work, as a part of the Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS).

CDE Name: Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS) -  Physical function moderate housework scale
Definition: Scale which represents the extent to which the participant health limits the ablity to perform moderate work around the house like vacuuming, sweeping floors or carrying in groceries, as a part of the Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS).
Short Description: Scale which represents the extent to which the participant health limits the ablity to perform moderate work around the house like vacuuming, sweeping floors or carrying in groceries, as a part of the Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS).

CDE Name: Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS) - Physical function item total t-score
Definition: Normalized t-score corresponding to the raw total score for the PROMIS Physical function  6a items
Short Description: Calculated normalized score

CDE Name: Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS) - Physical function item total
Definition: Calculated raw total score for the PROMIS Physical function 6a items
Short Description: Calculated raw total score

CDE Name: Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS) - Sleep problem assessment past week scale
Definition: Scale which represents how often the participant had a problem with sleep in the past 7 days, as part of the Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS).
Short Description: Scale which represents how often the participant had a problem with sleep in the past 7 days, as part of the Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS).

CDE Name: Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS) - Sleep quality assessment past week scale
Definition: Scale which represents the participant's description of his/her sleep quality in the past 7 days, as part of the Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS).
Short Description: Scale which represents the participant's description of his/her sleep quality in the past 7 days, as part of the Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS).

CDE Name: Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS) - Sleep refresh assessment past week scale
Definition: Scale which represents how often the participant's sleep was refreshing in the past 7 days, as part of the Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS).
Short Description: Scale which represents how often the participant's sleep was refreshing in the past 7 days, as part of the Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS).

CDE Name: Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS) - sleep disturbance 6a item total t-score
Definition: Normalized t-score corresponding to the raw total score for the PROMIS Sleep Disturbance 6a items
Short Description: Calculated normalized score

CDE Name: Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS) - sleep disturbance 6a item total
Definition: Calculated raw total score for the PROMIS Sleep Disturbance 6a items
Short Description: Calculated raw total score

CDE Name: Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS) - Sleep restlessness assessment past week scale
Definition: Scale which represents how often the participant's sleep was restless in the past 7 days, as part of the Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS).
Short Description: Scale which represents how often the participant's sleep was restless in the past 7 days, as part of the Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS).

CDE Name: Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS) - Sleep determination assessment past week scale
Definition: Scale which represents the extent to which the participant tried hard to get to sleep in the past 7 days, as a part of the Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS).
Short Description: Scale which represents the extent to which the participant tried hard to get to sleep in the past 7 days, as a part of the Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS).

CDE Name: Respondent relationship to participating child
Definition: Relationship between the parent/respondent (person answering questions for the child) and the child who is the main study participant/subject. Includes relationships that are biologic, adoptive, or step.
Short Description: Parent/responent's relationship to the study participant/subject child

CDE Name: Respondent relationship to participating child
Definition: The free-text field related to Proxy Relationship response of other
Short Description: The free-text field related to Proxy Relationship response of other

CDE Name: SDOH
Definition: Indicator the participant or any of the participants family members was unable to get childcare that they really needed within the past year, as a part of the HEAL CDE pain core demographics.
Short Description: Economic Stability - Social Need - Childcare

CDE Name: SDOH
Definition: Indicator the participant or any of the participants family members was unable to get clothing that they really needed within the past year, as a part of the HEAL CDE pain core demographics.
Short Description: Economic Stability - Social Need -Clothing

CDE Name: SDOH
Definition: Indicator the participant or any of the participants family members was unable to get food that they really needed within the past year, as a part of the HEAL CDE pain core demographics.
Short Description: Economic Stability - Social Need -Food

CDE Name: SDOH
Definition: Indicator the participant or any of the participants family members was unable to get housing that they really needed within the past year, as a part of the HEAL CDE pain core demographics.
Short Description: Economic Stability - Social Need -Housing

CDE Name: SDOH
Definition: Indicator the participant or any of the participants family members was unable to get internet that they really needed within the past year, as a part of the HEAL CDE pain core demographics.
Short Description: Economic Stability - Social Need -Internet/ Broadband

CDE Name: SDOH
Definition: Indicator the participant or any of the participants family members was unable to get medcine that they really needed within the past year, as a part of the HEAL CDE pain core demographics.
Short Description: Economic Stability - Social Need -Medicine or any health care (medical, dental, mental health, vision)

CDE Name: SDOH
Definition: Indicator the participant prefers not to answer if they or any of the participants family members was unable to get an item or service that they really needed within the past year, as a part of the HEAL CDE pain core demographics.
Short Description: Economic Stability - Social Need -Prefer not to answer

CDE Name: SDOH
Definition: Indicator the participant or any of the participants family members was unable to get an item or service they needed that was not listed above within the past year, as a part of the HEAL CDE pain core demographics.
Short Description: Economic Stability - Social Need -Other

CDE Name: SDOH
Definition: Description of the item or service the participant or any of the participants family members was unable to get that they really needed within the past year, as a part of the HEAL CDE pain core demographics.
Short Description: Economic Stability - Social Need -If other, specify

CDE Name: SDOH
Definition: Indicator the participant or any of the participants family members was unable to get phone that they really needed within the past year, as a part of the HEAL CDE pain core demographics.
Short Description: Economic Stability - Social Need -Phone (e.g., mobile or landline)

CDE Name: SDOH
Definition: Indicator the participant or any of the participants family members was unable to get transportation that they really needed within the past year, as a part of the HEAL CDE pain core demographics.
Short Description: Economic Stability - Social Need -Transportation (e.g., private or public)

CDE Name: SDOH
Definition: Indicator the participant or any of the participants family members was unable to get utilities that they really needed within the past year, as a part of the HEAL CDE pain core demographics.
Short Description: Economic Stability - Social Need -Utilities (e.g., gas, electric, propane, natural gas, etc.)

CDE Name: Sex birth type
Sex birth type child
Definition: Self-reported sex at birth of the participant/subject. The assemblage of physical properties or qualities by which male is distinguished from female; the physical difference between male and female; the distinguishing peculiarity of male or female.

Self-reported (or parent reported) participant/subject child's sex at birth. The assemblage of physical properties or qualities by which male is distinguished from female; the physical difference between male and female; the distinguishing peculiarity of male or female.
Short Description: Self-reported sex at birth of the participant/subject
Child's sex at birth.

CDE Name: Sleep night hours minutes duration
Definition: Duration in hours and minutes of sleep per night by the participant/subject.
Short Description: Duration in hours and minutes of sleep per night by the participant/subject.

CDE Name: Survey language
Definition: Language used for survey administration
Short Description: Language for surveys

CDE Name: Tobacco Alcohol Prescription medications and other Substance (TAPS) - Alcohol use female scale
Definition: Status indicating the female participant's alcohol use in the past 12 months as a part of the Tobacco Alcohol and Prescription medications and other Substance (TAPS)
Short Description: Status indicating the female participant's alcohol use in the past 12 months as a part of the Tobacco Alcohol and Prescription medications and other Substance (TAPS)

CDE Name: Tobacco Alcohol Prescription medications and other Substance (TAPS) - Alcohol use male scale
Definition: Status indicating the male participant's alcohol use in the past 12 months as a part of the Tobacco Alcohol and Prescription medications and other Substance (TAPS)
Short Description: Status indicating the male participant's alcohol use in the past 12 months as a part of the Tobacco Alcohol and Prescription medications and other Substance (TAPS)

CDE Name: Tobacco Alcohol Prescription medications and other Substance (TAPS) - Drug use scale
Definition: Status indicating the participant's drug use in the past 12 months as a part of the Tobacco Alcohol and Prescription medications and other Substance (TAPS)
Short Description: Status indicating the participant's drug use in the past 12 months as a part of the Tobacco Alcohol and Prescription medications and other Substance (TAPS)

CDE Name: Tobacco Alcohol Prescription medications and other Substance (TAPS) - Overall TAPS possible substance use indicator
Definition: Indicator evaluating the overall set of responses to the Tobacco Alcohol Prescription medications and other Substance (TAPS) part 1
Short Description: Overall TAPS part 1

CDE Name: Tobacco Alcohol Prescription medications and other Substance (TAPS) - Prescription medication use scale
Definition: Status indicating the participant's perscription medication use in the past 12 months as a part of the Tobacco Alcohol and Prescription medications and other Substance (TAPS)
Short Description: Status indicating the participant's perscription medication use in the past 12 months as a part of the Tobacco Alcohol and Prescription medications and other Substance (TAPS)

CDE Name: Tobacco Alcohol Prescription medications and other Substance (TAPS) -  Tobacco product use scale
Definition: Status indicating the participant's tobacco use in the past 12 months as a part of the Tobacco Alcohol and Prescription medications and other Substance (TAPS)
Short Description: Status indicating the participant's tobacco use in the past 12 months as a part of the Tobacco Alcohol and Prescription medications and other Substance (TAPS)

CDE Name: Race
Race child
Definition: Participant/subject self declared racial origination, independent of ethnic origination, using OMB approved categories

Race: Participant/subject child self declared (or parent reported) racial origination, independent of ethnic origination, using OMB approved categories. This reponse indicates that race is self-declared as unknown
Short Description: Participant/subject self declared racial origination, independent of ethnic origination, using OMB approved categories-  Unknown, Not provided or available
Child race -  Unknown.

CDE Name: Parent Race
Definition: Race: Parent/respondent self declared racial origination, independent of ethnic origination, using OMB approved categories. This reponse indicates that race is self-declared as unknown
Short Description: Parent/respondent race - Unknown.

CDE Name: Race
Race child
Definition: Participant/subject self declared racial origination, independent of ethnic origination, using OMB approved categories

Race: Participant/subject child self declared (or parent reported) racial origination, independent of ethnic origination, using OMB approved categories. This reponse indicates self-declared race is White, Denotes a person with European, Middle Eastern, or North African ancestral origin who identifies, or is identified, as White
Short Description: Participant/subject self declared racial origination, independent of ethnic origination, using OMB approved categories-  White, Denotes a person with European, Middle Eastern, or North African ancestral origin who identifies, or is identified, as White
Child race -  White

CDE Name: Parent Race
Definition: Race: Parent/respondent self declared racial origination, independent of ethnic origination, using OMB approved categories. This reponse indicates self-declared race is White, Denotes a person with European, Middle Eastern, or North African ancestral origin who identifies, or is identified, as White
Short Description: Parent/respondent race - White

CDE Name: Rural-Urban Commuting Area (RUCA) Codes - primary code
Definition: The rural-urban commuting area (RUCA) codes classify U.S. locations to reflect population density, urbanization, and daily commuting. The classification contains two levels. Whole numbers (1-10) delineate metropolitan, micropolitan, small town, and rural commuting areas based on the size and direction of the primary (largest) commuting flows.
Short Description: RUCA code: Primary

CDE Name: Rural-Urban Commuting Area (RUCA) Codes - secondary code
Definition: The rural-urban commuting area (RUCA) codes classify U.S. locations to reflect population density, urbanization, and daily commuting. The classification contains two levels. The 10 primary codes can be  further subdivided based on secondary commuting flows.
Short Description: RUCA code: Secondary
